required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Difference in Cerebral Oxygenation Between Propofol and Sevoflurane
clinical_study.official_title: The Difference in Cerebral Oxygenation Between Propofol and Sevoflurane

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of this study is to investigate whether propofol and sevoflurane have difference effect on cerebral oxygenation .

detailed_description.textblock: the purpose of this study:(1) to investigate the incidence of preoperative cerebral oxygenation abnormity (SjvO2 <55%) and its relationship with intraoperative cerebral desaturation and POCD. (2) To investigate the change of intraoperative cerebral oxygen supply and demand balance and the incidence of cerebral desaturation in patients with abnormal preoperative cerebral oxygenation during sevoflurane anesthesia. (3)To investigate the incidence of early POCD in patients with abnormal preoperative cerebral oxygenation during sevoflurane and propofol anesthesia.

primary_outcome.measure: the Incidence of Intraoperative Desaturation Between Propofol and Sevoflurane General Anesthesia
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline ,every hour in the operation period,after extubation
primary_outcome.description: SjvO2 were measured before anesthesia, after intubation, every hour during operation, after extubation by jugular vein blood and atrial blood gas analysis.The incidence of intraoperative cerebral desaturation was recorded when SjvO2<50%.

secondary_outcome.measure: the Incidence of Postoperative Cognitive Disfunction(POCD)Between Propofol and Sevoflurane General Anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of early POCD was recorded. The MMSE score and the Montreal cognitive assessment (MoCA) score were recorded 1day before surgery, 1-3 day after surgery and 5-7 day after surgery. The POCD was defined as MMSE score illiterate group ≤ 17, primary and secondary school group ≤ 20, junior high school and above group ≤ 24，or the MoCA score decreased 20% with the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: the Change in the Level of Serum BDNF(Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor ) Between Propofol and Sevoflurane Anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before anesthesia, after extubation ,1day after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: the Change in the Level of Serum s-100β Between Propofol and Sevoflurane Anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before anesthesia,after extubation,1 day after operation

other_outcome.time_frame: baseline , evey hour in the operation,afte extubation
other_outcome.description: heart rate, artery blood pressure,pulse oxygen saturation,temperature

other_outcome.time_frame: baseline,every hour in the operation,after extubation
other_outcome.description: including artery blood and blood from jugular vein bulb

arm_group.description: patients with preoperative SjvO2<55%,using the TIVA technology with propofol,
patients with preoperative SjvO2≥55%,using the TIVA technology with propofol,
patients with preoperative SjvO2<55%,using the VIMA technology with sevoflurane,
patients with preoperative SjvO2≥55%,using the VIMA technology with sevoflurane,

intervention.description: use total intravenous anesthesia with propofol

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients undergoing elective major surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- scheduled to take major surgery under general anesthesia over 18 years old classified as ASA class three or less
Exclusion Criteria:
- have a diagnosis of cerebrovascular disorder

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: ASA
measure.description: ASA I No organic, physiologic, biochemical or psychiatric disturbance ASA II A patient with mild systemic disease that results in no functional limitation. Examples: well-controlled hypertension, uncomplicated diabetes mellitus. ASA III A patient with severe systemic disease that results in functional impairment ASA IV Severe systemic disease that is a constant threat to life. ASA V Moribund condition in a patient who is not expected to survive with or without the operation. ASA VI Declared brain death patient whose organs are being harvested for transplantation.

outcome.description: The incidence of early POCD was recorded. The MMSE score and the Montreal cognitive assessment (MoCA) score were recorded 1day before surgery, 1-3 day after surgery and 5-7 day after surgery. The POCD was defined as MMSE score illiterate group ≤ 17, primary and secondary school group ≤ 20, junior high school and above group ≤ 24，or the MoCA score decreased 20% with the baseline.

certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
